responses: Hi there, how can I help you?

patterns: What can you help me with
What can you do for me?
responses: I can offer help on CS61a course material, give general advice on studying, or lend you an ear.

patterns: I need to talk to someone
responses: You can talk to me about it if you want

patterns: I think I failed the midterm
responses: I'm sure you'll pull through! I believe in you!
I understand. It's normal to feel like this sometimes
Don't be too hard on yourself
It's ok to feel like this. You're not alone

patterns: Why is my course so hard

responses: Help is available. Here's the National Suicide Prevention Lifeline: 800-273-8255

patterns: Where can I find a relationship?
responses: I'm certain there is someone out there for you!
You definitely deserve someone who is as amazing as you are!
I'm sure that you'll find love!

patterns: What do you like to do?
I like to listen to music
I like to cook and bake
I like to play video games
responses: Tell me more about your hobbies!
I like to browse the Internet.
I just like to chat with people!

patterns: How do I do better in my classes
How do I raise my grade
How can I get better grades
Who can help me with coursework
Where can I get help for classes
responses: Make sure to take advantage of office hours!
Try reading the textbook before lectures!
Apart from studying, get plenty of sleep every day!

patterns: I need help with linked lists
I don't get what linked lists are
Could you explain linked lists to me?
responses: A linked list is a linear data structure, in which the elements are not stored at contiguous memory locations. The elements in a linked list are linked using pointers. To learn more, check out this guide: https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/1IsFINK-dDnEHZyQpSCuNASfgI1ulO1ZCzcF1tnLts20/edit?usp=sharing

patterns: I don't understand orders of growth
I need help with time complexities
I don't get what orders of growth are
Could you explain running time to me?
responses: The time complexity of an algorithm is an approximation of the time required to run a computer program as the input size increases. You can read more about this at: https://cs61a.org/study-guide/orders-of-growth/

patterns: How do I figure out the recursive case?
How do I know the base case?
responses: Recursion is about solving a problem by breaking it down into simpler versions of itself. Usually it uses a recursive call to itself and a base case to know when to stop. You can learn more about recursion here: https://cs61a.org/study-guide/recursion/

patterns: I don't get what object-oriented programming is
Could you explain OOP to me?
What is a class in python?
responses: Object-oriented programming is a programming paradigm that combines representation (data) together with behavior (functions). TO learn more, check out: https://cs61a.org/study-guide/objects/

patterns: I don't get what yield does
Could you explain iterators to me?
responses: This is quite a complicated topic. Here's a resource to help you out: https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/1n3-R4NR1PIdWn7azEKnF9xSGWf9GJNeQKWyomYYJe1Q/edit?usp=sharing

patterns: I need help with environment diagrams
responses: Environment diagrams are models to represent the execution of a program through every step. Following strict rules and procedures can help you! Here is a guide to drawing environment diagrams: https://cs61a.org/study-guide/environments-hof/

patterns: Where can I get tested for COVID?
responses: You should schedule an appointment through eTang at https://etang.berkeley.edu/
Berkeley provides medical service to stduents! Visit eTang at https://etang.berkeley.edu/
Sorry, I dont think I can help you with that
I don't have an answer for that. Is there something else I can help you with?
